text: Okay, so I need to figure out the slope of the line of best fit shown in the scatterplot.

text: Let me recall that the slope of a line is calculated by the change in y divided by the change in x between two points on the line.

text: Let me write down the formula for slope: m = (y2 - y1)/(x2 - x1).

text: Plugging these into the formula: m = (9.3 - 0.2)/(5 - 0) = (9.1)/5.

text: 9 divided by 5 is 1.8, and 0.1 divided by 5 is 0.02.
